45,000 in Mass. set to lose their unemployment benefits

About one-fifth of those who are out of work will lose their unemployment benefits on Dec. 29 unless Congress renews a program for those struggling to find jobs. (Globe)
  • GOP Norquist pledge signees say they could break it

Fighting the sexual trafficking of children

Former victim becomes leader in fight against sex-trafficking

Asia Graves, once exploited as a child prostitute, is speaking out against child sex trafficking, as she did in her 2009 testimony that led to convictions. (Globe)
  • 11/23/10 Man sentenced to 25 years for role in sex ring

Reports: Mass. home sales, prices rise

One report saw a 21 percent rise in October sales compared to the same month in 2011, and another found the biggest price jump since June 2010. (Globe)

State Street bank deposits nearly double

The billions in additional deposits for one of the state’s largest financial institutions come as clients are giving up on alternatives that pay almost no interest. (Globe)
  • Graphic Deposits at banks in Massachusetts | Discuss

Ski areas look to rebound from 2011

After the worst ski season in 20 years, ski resorts are now offering discounts and more to attract patrons as mild climates loom. (Globe)

Study: Stimulating activities
keep brain young

In a new study researchers found that simple activities such as reading the newspaper, writing letters, visiting a library, attending a play or playing chess or checkers can all work to boost healthier brainpower among seniors.
